intro: Sida megalantha, commonly known as the large-leaved sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a rough texture and prominent veins. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are usually pink or purple in color. Sida megalantha is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
